medical_history.chief_complaint: Ulnar nerve transection following arthroscopic release of elbow contracture.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient underwent an arthroscopic release of the residual elbow contracture ten months after the initial injury. Postoperatively, he complained of numbness in the ring and small digits and weakness of finger abduction. Electrodiagnostic studies confirmed severe ulnar neuropathy. He continued to have a limited range of motion and presented for a second opinion fifteen months after the original injury. Physical examination revealed limited elbow range of motion and intact motor/sensory function of radial and median nerves but no light touch sensation in the ulnar nerve distribution.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a prior avulsion fracture of the coronoid process of the right ulna and an open release of the contracture and a subcutaneous ulnar nerve transposition.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a left-hand-dominant construction worker.
